business.headline: IndiGo's 10% flight curbs kick in, Centre redistributes slots to airlinesIndia's aviation sector is witnessing a strategic reshuffle as the government redistributes 10 per cent of IndiGo's flight operations to other domestic carriers. This phased approach aims to balance capacity while ensuring passenger convenience and connectivity.

Why most Indians are still underinsured despite buying insuranceSeveral insurer-backed studies show that a large share of Indian policyholders have life cover of less than five times their annual income. Most financial planners recommend at least 10 to 15 times annual income, and often more.

Will AI kill jobs across the globe and how can India ride the AI wave? Experts weigh inIn this India Today special show from the World Economic Forum in Davos, top artificial intelligence innovators share their perspectives on the global AI race, AI's impact on the Indian economy and much more.

From income protection to easier credit: What gig workers expect from Budget 2026Delivery partners, drivers and freelancers form the backbone of India's fast-growing gig economy, yet financial security remains fragile for many. As Budget 2026 approaches, gig workers are hoping for measures that offer income protection, smoother credit access and faster support during emergencies.

Gold shines at record highs: What should investors do now?With gold touching new lifetime highs, the metal has once again proved its role as a refuge in uncertain times. But for investors, the rally raises a key question: what is the right move at current levels? Let's have a look.

Are personal loans becoming the go-to option during medical emergencies?A sudden medical emergency can quickly turn into a financial crisis. With healthcare costs rising and insurance cover often falling short, many Indian families are increasingly turning to personal loans to bridge the gap.

Sensex sinks 770 points, Nifty tumbles as FII selling hits sentiment hardMarkets slipped sharply as foreign investor selling, sector-wide pressure and a weakening rupee crushed sentiment. With Nifty near a key support zone, the next few sessions could set the tone for February.

Sensex down nearly 800 points at closing: Why stock market fell todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 769.67 points at 81,537.70 and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 241.25 points to 25,048.65.

Sebi accuses PwC and EY executives in Yes Bank's 2022 share sale: ReportIn total, 19 individuals have been accused of insider trading violations. Seven are alleged to have traded using privileged information, while four are accused of sharing it.

Can Budget 2026 help make insurance more affordable for Indians?With healthcare costs rising and insurance still out of reach for many, Budget 2026 is being closely watched by households and insurers alike. Industry leaders believe the right tax and policy moves could make insurance more affordable for millions.

French President's viral Davos shades give iVision Tech a 38 crore stock boostFrench President Emmanuel Macron's look during his World Economic Forum speech went viral online and the market reacted instantly.

From easier credit to insurance: What MSMEs want from Union Budget 2026As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, MSMEs are looking for practical support to ease everyday financial pressures. Industry leaders say better access to credit, lower insurance costs and simpler rules could help small businesses grow with confidence.

Is Rs 50,000 salary enough to invest? Sebi advisor explains what actually worksFinancial advisors say this income level is enough to begin building a long-term portfolio, provided the focus remains on discipline, safety and clear financial goals.

IndiGo share price down 4% after Q3 results: Buy, sell or hold?IndiGo share price: The stock slipped as much as 3.9% during early trade to hit an intraday low of Rs 4,723.60. It later recovered part of the losses but continued to trade in the red.

Gold and silver hit new highs again. Should you still buy?While the domestic trend remains sharply bullish, experts say understanding the broader backdrop can help investors think about why the rally is persisting and what it could mean for portfolios this year.

Infosys to hire 20,000 graduates in FY27 as AI demand surges: ReportInfosys is gearing up for heavier AI workloads in 2026 and beyond, and the scale of its campus hiring shows where the company believes client spending is beginning to stabilise and grow.
Sensex, Nifty open in green over improved global cues; TCS up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 77.47 points to 82,384.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.95 points to 25,321.85 as of 9:24 am.

8th Pay Commission: Employee bodies to meet soon to finalise salary hike demandsThe meeting will be held under the banner of the National Council (Staff Side) of the Joint Consultative Machinery, which represents central government employees in discussions with the government.

Shadowfax IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status and listing gainsInvestors who applied for Shadowfax IPO can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the portal of KFin Technologies Limited, which is the official registrar for the issue.

Trump sues JPMorgan Chase, CEO Jamie Dimon for $5bn over alleged debankingDonald Trump has filed a $5 billion lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase for closing his bank accounts. The case raises questions about political bias and banking practices in the US.

entertainment.headline: Linkin Park's Emily Armstrong wears Assamese Gamusa during India debut. Watch Linkin Park's first India concert in Bengaluru saw new vocalist Emily Armstrong wearing a traditional Assamese gamusa during their performance of Faint, drawing significant attention online and prompting discussions about cultural appreciation.

Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's Haq tops Netflix charts in Pakistan and Nigeria Actors Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's Haq has sparked significant discussion in Pakistan and Nigeria. Viewers and public figures in both countries are reacting strongly to its themes of faith, law, marriage, and women's rights.

Shah Rukh Khan's King release date announced: Check details Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film King is set for a December 2026 release. The Siddharth Anand directorial marks their much-anticipated reunion.

Mona Singh thanks fans as Border 2 earns strong audience praise Mona Singh has garnered significant appreciation following the release of Border 2, as audiences and critics highlight her impactful performance.

Battle of Galwan song Maatrubhoomi: Salman Khan strikes a patriotic chord Maatrubhumi, the first song from the upcoming war drama Battle of Galwan, has been released ahead of Republic Day. Featuring Salman Khan, the track honours the nation and its soldiers. The song features vocals by Arijit Singh, Shreya Ghoshal and Master Mani Dharamkot

Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt, daughter booked for alleged fraud of Rs 13.5 crore A businessman has accused filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his daughter, Krishna Bhatt, of defrauding him of Rs 13.5 crore through false promises of investment returns. The Economic Offences Wing has taken over the investigation.

From 7 am to 3 am, Border 2 drives round-the-clock screenings: Report The release of Border 2 sees theatre chains across India reportedly introducing post-midnight screenings. Some shows are running as late as 3 am, in response to high audience demand during the Republic Day weekend.

Rani Mukerji faces the '3 Khans' on Kapil Sharma show ahead of Mardaani 3. Watch Rani Mukerji is set to appear on The Great Indian Kapil Show to promote her upcoming film Mardaani 3. The episode will feature comedians Sunil Grover, Krushna Abhishek and Kiku Sharda impersonating the three Khans.

Anupam Kher, Ravi Kishan hit the gym together. Find out which film it's for Veteran actor Anupam Kher shared a glimpse of an intense workout with Ravi Kishan. The post is drawing attention online for both the actors' dedication to fitness and preparation for their upcoming film.

Border 2: Sonu Nigam backs Sandese Aate Hain return amid Javed Akhtar critique Sonu Nigam has addressed Javed Akhtar's opposition to reworking old songs. Nigam, who re-created Sandese Aate Hain for Border 2 alongside other singers, acknowledged Akhtar's viewpoint while expressing the song's significance to the franchise.

New talent, timeless craft: Malayalam cinema's new-age actors and their legacy As Malayalam cinema expands its pan-Indian and global footprint, a new generation of actors is stepping into larger creative and commercial roles — balancing the industry's legacy of rooted storytelling with Gen-Z authenticity, genre experimentation and growing cross-industry ambition.

Border 2 box office Day 1: Sunny Deol film beats Dhurandhar, Chhaava; not Gadar 2 Sunny Deol's Border 2 opened on a solid note at the box office on Friday. While it surpassed the first day business of both Chhaava and Dhurandhar, it couldn't overshadow Sunny's previous blockbuster, Gadar 2.

Mrunal Thakur- Dhanush viral wedding photo sparks buzz, but here's the truth A digitally created image of actors Mrunal Thakur and Dhanush at a wedding altar has gone viral. The photo has fuelled speculation about their marital status.

Border 2 isn't a bad film, just not the Border we remember Border 2 is a sincere, large-scale war film that struggles under the weight of an iconic legacy. Despite visible effort and solid performances, it can't quite recreate the emotional intimacy that made Border unforgettable.

Anthony Hopkins discusses family estrangement and why he won't 'waste blood' Anthony Hopkins offered a candid account of his estranged relationship with his daughter during a recent podcast. The veteran British actor said he wishes her well but is moving on now.

No Spice Girl action: DJ Fat Tony first guest to recount Beckham wedding row drama DJ Fat Tony opened up a tense incident during Brooklyn Beckham and Nicola Peltz Beckham's wedding. He recalled that Victoria's dance left Nicola in tears.

The OTT takeover: How streaming giants now assert control over South cinema The OTT revolution has transformed South Indian cinema's business model since the pandemic. This shift places streaming platforms in control, challenging traditional theatrical practices and producers' influence.

Free Bert review: There's more to Bert Kreischer than his loud shirtless outingsRelease Date:Mon Jan 12, 2026 Free Bert features Bert Kreischer as a fictionalised version of himself navigating the image-obsessed culture of Beverly Hills. The Netflix sitcom explores the tension between his loud, shirtless persona and the desire to change for his daughters, questioning if maturity requires self-erasure. Here's our review.

Ishaan Khatter praises Neeraj Ghaywan after Homebound misses out on Oscars Ishaan Khatter praised Neeraj Ghaywan after Homebound missed getting a nomination at the 2026 Oscars. The film also featured actors Vishal Jethwa and Janhvi Kapoor in key roles.

general news.headline: Bangladesh officially out of T20 WC, ICC names Scotland as replacement: SourcesThe ICC informed Bangladesh via a letter on Saturday, January 24 that they have been replaced by Scotland for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026, according to sources.

US may roll back 25% India tariffs after Russian oil import cuts: Scott BessentUS Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Trump administration may consider rolling back 25% of the 50% tariffs on India, citing a sharp decline in India's purchases of Russian oil.

Indian man shoots wife, 3 relatives dead in US; children hid in closetThe shooter has been identified as Vijay Kumar, 51, and the victims are his wife, Meemu Dogra, 43, and their relatives Gourav Cumar, 33, Nidhi Chander, 37, and Harish Chander, 38.

Muslims might face bias: Amartya Sen says 'rushed' Bengal SIR risks democracyNobel laureate Amartya Sen has warned that the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in West Bengal is being conducted in undue haste.

Cowardice cosplaying as tantrum: Bangladesh's manufactured World Cup crisisBy weaponising fabricated security concerns to settle a political score, the BCB has traded its integrity for domestic applause, holding its own players hostage in a transparent act of geopolitical duplicity.

Trump says Nato avoided Afghanistan war front line. Here is the realityUS President Donald Trump's claim that Nato troops stayed back from the front lines during the 20-year war in Afghanistan has sparked widespread outrage among European military veterans and relatives of the fallen. Did Nato avoid the Afghan war front line? Here is what facts and data tell us.

Djokovic rewrites history with 400 Grand Slam wins, Swiatek survives huge scareAustralian Open: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic stormed into the fourth round at Melbourne Park after beating Botic van de Zandschulp of the Netherlands 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 (4) at the Rod Laver Arena.

Why Gen Z is the chhoti bahu of the corporate worldHandcrafted ByOur Editors Gen Z is the chhoti bahu of the corporate world, setting boundaries, prioritising mental health, and refusing to glorify burnout. Millennials, the badi bahu of workplaces, quietly carried the weight of commitment and sacrifice, yet rarely received credit for it.

Shah Rukh Khan's King release date announced: Check detailsShah Rukh Khan's upcoming film King is set for a December 2026 release. The Siddharth Anand directorial marks their much-anticipated reunion.

Vande Mataram deserves same status as national anthem: Tamil Nadu GovernorTamil Nadu Governor R N Ravi emphasised that Bharat is more than a landmass, it is a mother, and advocated for Vande Mataram to be given equal status as the national anthem. His remarks highlight ongoing cultural debates in Tamil Nadu regarding national symbols.

Unapologetic: Shashi Tharoor on his Op Sindoor stance amid Congress rift buzzAmid rift buzz with Congress leadership, Shashi Tharoor said he never broke party lines in Parliament, except on Operation Sindoor, where he backed a kinetic response after the Pahalgam terror attack.
Krishna Karunesh appointed Noida CEO days after M Lokesh sacked over techie's deathIAS officer Krishna Karunesh has been appointed the new Noida CEO, days after M Lokesh was removed from the post.

The saas–bahu drama in the Beckham household, and Brooklyn caught in the middleWhen two female leads of a man's life do not get along, getting torn in between is often the expected consequence. He is expected to be neutral, but neutrality often looks like betrayal to both sides.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

He had hit me, I killed him: Chilling confession in Delhi cafe murderFaizan, 24, was shot dead at Mr King Lounge and Cafe in Delhi's Welcome area. In a chilling Instagram post, the accused confessed to committing the crime and has denied role of his father or family members in the murder.

Bangladesh will now be seen as potential troublemaker in cricket: Ex BCB secretaryFormer Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) general secretary Syed Ashraful Haque has slammed the current board administration for pulling out of the T20 World Cup 2026 in India. He fears Bangladesh will now be seen as a troublemaker in world cricket and have put their future in jeopardy.

IAS, IPS officers' simple registered marriage gets internet's nod of approvalAn IAS and IPS officer chose a simple registered marriage, rejecting lavish celebrations, which received nationwide praise and discussions on modest weddings.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Border 2 isn't a bad film, just not the Border we rememberBorder 2 is a sincere, large-scale war film that struggles under the weight of an iconic legacy. Despite visible effort and solid performances, it can't quite recreate the emotional intimacy that made Border unforgettable.

Monster winter storm sweeps US, 7000 flights cancelled over weekendA massive winter storm is threatening to blanket nearly half of the United States with snow, sleet and ice, while plunging temperatures to bone-chilling lows and triggering widespread power outages.

Is your satellite insured? PSLV loss exposes a costly blind spotThe recent loss of private satellites on the PSLV-C62 mission highlights a critical lack of financial protection for Indian startups. As commercial activity scales, building a robust insurance ecosystem is essential to sustain India's orbital ambitions.

sports.headline: Novak Djokovic escapes punishment after shot in anger nearly hits ballgirl: Watch Novak Djokovic escaped sanction after a ball struck in frustration narrowly missed a ballgirl during his third-round win at the Australian Open, before he went on to seal victory and a historic 400th Grand Slam match win.

Sourav Ganguly's coaching mantra: A friend, a mentor and something more Ahead of the SA20 final, Sourav Ganguly offers rare insight into his coaching philosophy and why being a guide matters more than being in charge.

Wawrinka goes full Stone Cold Steve Austin, exits AUS Open with beer toast Stan Wawrinka marked his final Australian Open appearance with a heartfelt farewell, and enjoyed a beer toast in Melbourne as he made his exit from the tournament. Wawrinka played his final match against Taylor Fritz.

Djokovic rewrites history with 400 Grand Slam wins, Swiatek survives huge scare Australian Open: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic stormed into the fourth round at Melbourne Park after beating Botic van de Zandschulp of the Netherlands 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 (4) at the Rod Laver Arena.

Bangladesh officially out of T20 WC, ICC name Scotland as replacement: Sources The ICC informed Bangladesh via a letter on Saturday, January 24 that they have been replaced by Scotland for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026, according to sources.

If ICC members support BAN, it won't be Indian Cricket Council: Ex PCB chief Former PCB chairman Najam Sethi urges cricketing nations to support Bangladesh amid concerns about the ICC's alleged bias towards India. Bangladesh have pulled out of the T20 World Cup 2026, citing security concerns.

MS Dhoni begins IPL 2026 preparations? CSK icon's Jharkhand nets video goes viral MS Dhoni has sparked fresh IPL 2026 buzz after a Jharkhand nets video went viral. Wearing yellow pads, the CSK icon's early return to batting has fans dreaming of one final title push.

Heartbroken Naomi Osaka pulls out midway from Australian Open: Can't risk more damage Naomi Osaka withdrew from the Australian Open before her third-round match against Maddison Inglis, ending her campaign early to focus on recovery. Maddison Inglis, on the other hand, advanced to the Round of 16.

Ishan Kishan's fearless mindset sets him apart: Ashwin amazed by batter's Raipur blitz R Ashwin was left amazed by Ishan Kishan's Raipur blitz against New Zealand. The former India spinner praised Kishan's fearless mindset, forged in domestic cricket, as the quality that truly separates him from the rest.

Ex Bangladesh captain urges BCB to save cricket after T20 World Cup boycott Former Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto has called on the Bangladesh Cricket Board to take decisive action to protect the future of the sport amid ongoing uncertainty over participation in the T20 World Cup.

Suryakumar Yadav credits wife Devisha Shetty's advice for Raipur T20I comeback knockIND vs NZ: Suryakumar Yadav's return to form in Raipur had a personal touch behind it. The India captain credited his wife's advice for slowing down, regaining confidence, and powering a match-winning knock against New Zealand.

Pratika Rawal, Vaishnavi Sharma and Kranti earn maiden Test call up for Australia tourPratika Rawal has earned her maiden Test call-up as India prepare for the one-off game against Australia in Perth. India will tour Australia for three T20Is and as many ODIs along with one Test, with the tour set to begin on February 15 in Sydney with T20I series.

Bangladesh will now be seen as potential troublemaker in cricket: Ex BCB secretaryFormer Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) general secretary Syed Ashraful Haque has slammed the current board administration for pulling out of the T20 World Cup 2026 in India. He fears Bangladesh will now be seen as a troublemaker in world cricket and have put their future in jeopardy.

Sinner heat break controversy: He didn't win, Aus Open won it for him, say angry fansJannik Sinner's heat-hit escape against Eliot Spizzirri has divided opinion at the Australian Open. Fans raged as a mid-match heat stoppage flipped momentum and helped the defending champion survive into Round 4.

Inside Abhishek Sharma's mind: What makes him the No.1 T20I batter in the worldThe evolution of Abhishek Sharma is the most important plotline for India ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. In this story we go inside his mind and try to find out what made him the No.1 batter in the T20I format.

How Suryakumar Yadav rediscovered his golden touch? Sunil Gavaskar explainsSunil Gavaskar highlights a major technical shift that helped Suryakumar Yadav regain form. Suryakumar played a scintillating knock of 82 off 37 balls, laced with nine fours and four sixes, to help India chase down 209 in second T20I against New Zealand.

Suryakumar Yadav back in form: Shivam Dube delighted after his prediction comes trueShivam Dube's faith in Suryakumar Yadav finally paid off in Raipur. The India captain's return to form against New Zealand delighted Dube and powered a record-breaking chase.

Ishan Kishan's Cinderella Man comeback: An overlooked talent to India's wildcardIshan Kishan continues to stun people, and he showed that he is currently Indian cricket's Cindrella Man with his match-winning knock against New Zealand in Raipur. After a hard grind back in the domestic circuit, Jharkhand seems to have matured as a player and a leader.

India too reliant on Abhishek? Champions silence concerns, fire T20 World Cup warningIND vs NZ: India brushed aside all the lingering doubts regarding them in style, chasing down a whopping total in record time and proving they are indeed the champions and the ones to beat.

Can I do it again? How Ishan Kishan found his answers during India hiatusIshan Kishan revealed how his time away from the Indian team helped him rediscover himself after his match-winning 76 against New Zealand in Raipur. The wicketkeeper-batter spoke about domestic cricket hustle and how he made his way back into the team.

Suryakumar Yadav jokes he was mad at Ishan Kishan during statement knock in RaipurIND vs NZ: Suryakumar Yadav revealed he was briefly "angry" with Ishan Kishan for hogging the strike, after the duo smashed 82 off 37 and 76 off 32 to script India's stunning 209-run chase in Raipur.

AUS Open, Day 7 Live: Djokovic into Round 4, Rybakina beats ValentovaAustralian Open Day 7 Live Score and updates: Novak Djokovic is currently in action against Botic van de Zandschulp on Centre Court. Earlier, Jannik Sinner scripted a gritty comeback to seal his Round 4 spot, though not without controversy. Drama continues to brew on Day 7 at the Australian Open.

Watch: Bangladesh sports advisor acknowledges T20 World Cup fate on live TVT20 World Cup: Bangladesh sports advisor Asif Nazrul appeared to concede the team's uncertain T20 World Cup fate on live TV, as the standoff over playing matches in India threatens to push Bangladesh out of the tournament.

Raipur T20I: Ishan-daar, Surya-uday again as India race to 209 in world record chaseIshan Kishan's 76 off 32 and Suryakumar Yadav's first T20I fifty in 23 innings powered India to a record chase vs New Zealand in Raipur. India finished off the chase within 15.2 overs to smash a world record in T20Is.

IND vs NZ: Ishan Kishan channels inner Rishabh Pant, sends bat flying in RaipurIshan Kishan channeled his inner Rishabh Pant as the southpaw sent the bat flying in Raipur during his record-breaking fifty against New Zealand.

Delhi Capitals' 16-year-old prodigy ruled out of WPL 2026 due to injuryWPL 2026: 16-year-old Deeya Yadav has been ruled out of the remainder of WPL 2026 due to injury, forcing Delhi Capitals to name Pragati Singh and E Srujana as replacements as their playoff race intensifies.

Players not consulted in Bangladesh's T20 World Cup boycott: ReportThe Bangladesh players weren't consulted before the decision was made to boycott the T20 World Cup 2026, according to a latest report. Bangladesh is all set to be replaced by Scotland from the T20 World Cup 2026.

Cruz Hewitt's son chills with Federer twins at Australian OpenThe next generation of a famous tennis rivalry shared a moment at Melbourne Park as Cruz Hewitt watched the Australian Open alongside Roger Federer's twin daughters.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
